FESI.Interpreter
Class ScopeChain

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--FESI.Interpreter.ScopeChain
public class ScopeChain
extends Object

The scope chaine has established by WITH statements. Used to lookup values by name.

Method Summary

an ESReference object

getValue

public ESValue getValue(String identifier)
                 throws EcmaScriptException
Return a value for an object in the scope chain. return ESUndefined for undefined properties of existing objects, but generate an error for unexistent object.

A variant of getProperty is used, which will call recursively this routine and the getProperty in a previous scope until all scopes have been examined or a value is returned. This avoid the call of hasProperty followed by a second call to getProperty to get the property value.

Parameters:
identifier - The name of the object
Returns:
The value of the object, possibly ESUndefined
Throws:
EcmaScriptException - if no global object has that value

getValue

public ESValue getValue(String identifier,
                        int hash)
                 throws EcmaScriptException
Return a value for an object in the scope chain. return ESUndefined for undefined properties of existing objects, but generate an error for unexistent object.

A variant of getProperty is used, which will call recursively this routine and the getProperty in a previous scope until all scopes have been examined or a value is returned. This avoid the call of hasProperty followed by a second call to getProperty to get the property value.

Parameters:
identifier - The name of the object
hash - The hash code of the element (for optimization)
Returns:
The value of the object, possibly ESUndefined
Throws:
EcmaScriptException - if no global object has that value

doIndirectCall

public ESValue doIndirectCall(Evaluator evaluator,
                              ESObject thisObject,
                              String functionName,
                              int hash,
                              ESValue[] arguments)
                       throws EcmaScriptException
Call a function defined by name in the scope chain.

A variant of doCall is used, which will call recursively this routine and the doCall in a previous scope until all scopes have been examined or a value is returned. This avoid the call of hasProperty followed by a second call to getProperty to get the property value.

Parameters:
evaluator - The evaluator doing the call
thisObject - The 'this' object of the call
functionName - The name of the function to call
hash - The hash code of the function name (for optimization)
arguments - The parameters of the call
Returns:
The result of the call, possibly NULL
Throws:
EcmaScriptException - for any error
